p: As for Coriander EO, its antibacterial activity was reported by several authors [ 92, 93], this antibacterial activity can be explained by its chemical composition whose major component proved to be Linalool (60.91%) and its complex interactions with different individual components [ 94- 96], the antibacterial activity in question would be due to disrupting bacterial cell walls, inhibiting bacterial enzyme activity and suppressing translation of certain regulatory gene products [ 92]. More recently, a new antimicrobial peptide, namely “plantaricin CS” with broad antibacterial activity was isolated from the coriander leaf extract [ 97].
